2.text: No doubt but ye are the people, And wisdom shall die with you.

3.text: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you; Yea, who knoweth not such things as these?

4.text: I am as one that is a laughing-stock to his neighbour, A man that called upon God, And He answered him; The just, the innocent man is a laughing-stock,

5.text: A contemptible brand in the thought of him that is at ease, A thing ready for them whose foot slippeth.

6.text: The tents of robbers prosper, And they that provoke God are secure, In whatsoever God bringeth into their hand.

7.text: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; And the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee;

8.text: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee; And the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee;

9.text: Who knoweth not among all these, That the hand of the LORD hath wrought this?

10.text: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, And the breath of all mankind.—

11.text: Doth not the ear try words, Even as the palate tasteth its food?

12.text: Is wisdom with aged men, And understanding in length of days?—

13.text: With Him is wisdom and might; He hath counsel and understanding.

14.text: Behold, He breaketh down, and it cannot be built again; He shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.

15.text: Behold, He withholdeth the waters, and they dry up; Also He sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.

16.text: With Him is strength and sound wisdom; The deceived and the deceiver are His.

17.text: He leadeth counsellors away stripped, And judges maketh He fools.

18.text: He looseth the bond of kings, And bindeth their loins with a girdle.

19.text: He leadeth priests away stripped, And overthroweth the mighty.

20.text: He removeth the speech of men of trust, And taketh away the sense of the elders.

21.text: He poureth contempt upon princes, And looseth the belt of the strong.

22.text: He uncovereth deep things out of darkness, And bringeth out to light the shadow of death.

23.text: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them; He enlargeth the nations, and leadeth them away.

24.text: He taketh away the heart of the chiefs of the people of the land, And causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.

25.text: They grope in the dark without light, And He maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.
